article.description: Lamond Murray Jr. scored 20 points while Jett Raines finished with 18 as Pepperdine beat Brigham Young 71-65 Saturday.
article.headline: Murray helps lift Pepperdine past BYU 71-65
article.linkText: Murray helps lift Pepperdine past BYU 71-65
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. -- Lamond Murray Jr. scored 20 points while Jett Raines finished with 18 as Pepperdine beat Brigham Young 71-65 Saturday. Pepperdine (13-7, 6-3 West Coast Conference) moved into sole possession of third place in conference a half-game ahead of BYU (14-7, 5-3). Nick Emery's 3-point play with 4:02 left in the game put the Cougars up 59-58. Raines scored, BYU's Chase Fischer hit a jumper, and Raines followed with another basket to put the Waves up for good. Stacy Davis made two free throws and Murray hit a 3 to make it 67-61 with 1:52 left. Kyle Collinsworth and Fischer each hit two free throws and BYU called timeout with 31 seconds left. Raines made two free throws for a 69-65 lead before Fischer missed a 3 on the Cougars' next possession. Davis made two free throws for the game's final margin. Collinsworth finished with 18 points, Nick Emery had 17 and Fischer added 15.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
